Function regression just means evolving neural networks that 
approximate a target function, which can be any function at all.
It doesn't have to do with the function being inline or not, and it 
doesn't have to be a linear approximation.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Chad Bohannan" <chad@b...> wrote:
> remind me what function regression means? this doesn't sound like 
using
> linear approximations for the transfer function...
> is that where you have pointers to functions, instead of inline 
function
> calls?
> chad
